oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Complete mitochondrial genome sequence of the global invasive species (Hemiptera: Membracidae: Smiliinae)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Yu, Ruitao
Feng, Leining
Yuan, Xiangqun
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: invasive species
Hemiptera
Membracidae
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Stictocephala bisonia Kopp et Yonke, 1977, an invasive alien species colonizing Taibai County, Shaanxi Province, China, belongs to the subfamily Smiliinae. The total mitogenome sequence size is 15,803â€‰bp in length, consists of 13 protein-coding genes, 22 transfer RNA genes, two ribosomal RNA genes and one control region, and shows a positive AT skew. Phylogenetic analysis results strongly support that treehoppers (Membracidae and Aetalionidae) are monophyletic, and indicate that Smiliinae could be proposed as a separate family.
